title: DOM contents not ready after first update in incognito/private window.
body:
**Bug**

**Current behavior:**

I am attempting to load data from an API, display, and then scroll to a URL fragment deep in the document. Window only partially scrolls.

This may have more to do with browser behavior but I can't figure out how to reliably wait for content to be painted before scrolling it into view on the first attempt.

**Here's an example showing the issue:**
1. open a _new_ incognito (Chrome) or private (Firefox) window.
2. paste (or type, sorry FF) this URL - https://jsbin.com/wifopagasu/edit?js,output
- data will be loaded from iTunes and saved to state
- `render` is triggered
- `componentDidUpdate` is triggered
- `window.requestAnimationFrame` is used to let DOM painting occur
- DOM node deep in document is queried and attempted to scroll into view (correct node has a red background)

I've never seen this work with a fresh incognito/private window.

[Here's an issue](https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/2659) where using `requestAnimationFrame` is suggested.
[Here is a SO answer with discussion about this.](http://stackoverflow.com/a/28748160/184532)

**What is the expected behavior?**
DOM node scrolled into view

**Versions of React:** `15.1+`

**Browsers / OS:** `Mac OS X 10.11.6`

**Did not work with previous versions of React**
